title.narrative: Support policy design for public procurement for SMEs and innovation in Costa Rica (Costa Rica)

description.narrative: In 2015, Costa Rica established SICOP which is a central e-public procurement system. However, only 36% of public organizations are using SICOP. Since approximately 95% of the total Costa Rican industries are consist of SMEs, it is necessary for these industries to take part in the public procurement system. In this context, it is important to share experiences and know-how of Korea's public procurement system. By 2019/20 KSP-IDB joint consulting project, The KSP team will undertake a feasibility study of establishing a business Platform for SMEs, and propose policies for public procurement. The main tasks are as follows: 1. research on current status of public procurement system for SMEs in Costa Rica, 2. Case study on public procurement system development and e-government service in South Korea, 3. feasibility study to establish business platform for SMEs, 4. Capacity building program, 5. Policy suggestion and sharing.​
